data.title: Fair
data.text: Some servers are wonderful, but I must have caught others on a "bad day". Order was placed wrong, friend's drink came out with dinner (instead of in the 15 minutes while waiting). Quality of food is good, average pricing. Comfortable ambiance. Adequate for hotel dining.

data.title: Confused, disorganized, and over priced
data.text: We went for their Lenten fish special.  Very few choices on the menu.  The special was crab legs, but they didn't have enough of the nut crackers to go around so we had no way of cracking open the crab legs.  The service was very slow. I hadn't been there in years, but their advertising enticed us to give it a try.  Big mistake.  Then the check arrived.  Bigger mistake.  With all the great choices within a few blocks, I can't imagine ever going back.

data.title: Decent Hotel Restaurant!
data.text:
Usual winter weather kept me from leaving hotel.  I decided to eat at the lounge rather than remove car from parking garage. 
I had the calamari which was lightly battered and excellently seasoned, as well as the Gorgonzola, fig and caramelized onion flat bread and this too was very good.  Prices are not bad considering a hotel.

data.title: Good for Thanksgiving......
data.text:
If someone in an impoverished country could see what a "brunch buffet" of ours is like, they would be shocked.  We take it for granted.

Rather than cook this year, the family decided to go out.  Not an easy decision.  The buffet was plentiful and varied, to put it mildly.  Multiple carving stations, veggies, salad bar, mashed potatoes sweet potatoes and yams, stuffing, salad bar........on and on.  There was also a section of the buffet with "kids" foods, but tempting for all of us.

As a pescetarian, I did not expect to find a whole lot of choices, but there was eggplant parmesan, the salad bar and cold shrimp (waterlogged).  I wish with ALL of the choices that they had that there would have been a fish choice.  I really can't complain, though, everything was very good, and family said that all of the meats were good as well.

Desserts....ice cream to scoop yourself with all of the toppings, several types of pies, cakes, puddings, and on and on.

This could have been like the Golden Corral.....lots of variety, all of it bad, but I think they did a great job on service, quality and variety.

data.title: Radison Champagne Brunch
data.text: We went to this place in downtown Utica for the Sunday Champagne Brunch. We were joining friends and family of a wedding party for a sit down meal. We found it to be very good. So many choices of food. You can actually eat a full breakfast and follow it up with dinner! I would skip the champagne. The sausage was a little tough but after that it was all good! A bit pricey at $25/person but worth it in the many choices.

data.title: terrible disappointment
data.text: By all means, STAY AWAY from the sunday brunch at the Radisson garden grille.  I thought it strange that there were so few diners there when we arrived at around noon on a sunday, but soon found out why.  The quality and offered choices of food has always been good, but sadly on this visit we found both to be lacking.  The meat stations were overdone and dried out, the breakfast choices were cold and tasted terrible, and the prices were raised to more than we ever paid making it extremely expensive for a poor quality meal.  The wait staff was excellent, but to top it all off, management could not deliver an accurate bill after 4 tries, repeatedly handing us a bill that was incorrectly overpriced, even over their already expensive prices.  Of course if we hadn't checked it we would have paid an even more outrageous price for an already expensive meal.  After the fourth erroneous bill was received and given back to management, the frustrated manager screamed at us, the customer, with no regard to trying to fix an outrageous situation.  The fifth attempt at a bill was still overpriced by 5 dollars (the original more than 30 dollars so an improvement), but we paid it anyway just to be able to leave......we had been waiting for a bill for more than 25 minutes at that point.  So much for the customer being right, at this restaurant in Utica NY, you're not only wrong but you are the subject of ridicule and badmouthing from their management.  Anyway, this will certainly be our LAST visit to the Radisson Utica, and I strongly suggest you think twice and stay away from it as well.

data.title: Worst Christmas Dinner or any kind of dinner we have ever had!
data.text:
We have been going to the Radisson Garden Grill for Christmas dinner for four years now (ONLY because it is the only restaurant open in the Utica area on Christmas and we don't live there so can't cook for ourselves)…..It has never been good and is very expensive.  This year was the worst of all.  Every meat was way over done and dried out.  I watched the young man at the carving station carve three different prime ribs and every one of them was over done!  The ham was dry and hard.  The chicken was so dried out you couldn't even get it off the bone and the stuffed pork was cold, dry and tough.  
I must say the staff was excellent.  No complaints regarding them or their service!  
I did not mention any of the disappointment while I was there because, after all, it was Christmas and I wouldn't like to cause a scene or problem at that time.
I am truly hoping the Garden Grill Restaurant finds a way to fix whatever their problem is because, as I said, it is the only restaurant open on Christmas!

data.title: Great little hidden gem
data.text: We were travelling with a hockey team and stayed at the Hotel Utica but walked down the block and found this restaurant in the Radisson hotel.  We were very pleased that they could accomodate us at the last minute (which was awesome!) and we had the choice having the buffet which had a lot of choices or ordering off the menu.  Our group did both.  The hockey players enjoyed the buffet and ate to their hearts content while some of us ate off the menu.  The food was served quickly and was very good.  I would recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great breakfast buffet
data.text: Open at 6:30 it was great for a cup of coffee and breakfast from the buffet. Food was good and fresh. Nice selection from eggs, sausage,French toast,fresh fruit, toast.

data.title: sundays
data.text:
only recommending the replete buffet brunch, cornucopia of food, all delicious, bright happy dining room, friendly waitstaff.
worth the money.

data.title: Okay, a bit pricey
data.text: The meal was well prepared but not extraordinary. The service was friendly and attentive. With all the options in town this would not be my first choice.

data.title: Staff had fun and food was fine
data.text: The staff in the restaurant worked hard and had fun. Service was great and the food was fine. I had at least three staff members check on me to see if there was anything I needed.

data.title: Truly great brunch
data.text: The Garden Grill has a spectacular Sunday brunch complete with mimosas, an omelette station, a carving station with prime rib and other meats, traditional breakfast food like waffles, bacon, fresh berries, eggs, etc;. but it goes on to include seafood and other entrees, plus local favorites like Italian-seasoned "greens."  There are also a lot of fabulous desserts such as cannoli, cheesecake, and a variety of decadent chocolate treats.   I had a crepe with Grand Marnier on my last visit.   Well worth the price.

data.title: Last time we will go there for Easter brunch
data.text: Despite reservation waited 20 minutes for a table to get ready. Buffet had some decent food but when something ran out it took a long time to be replenished. The worst thing was the desert table. Dirty utensils all over and it just looked gross . By 2:00 almost everything was gone, literally plates with just crumbs on them and items never replaced. Several people were complaining.

data.title: Would like more consistency
data.text: Depending on the day , you could get a great meal or an average meal. The setting is wonderful. Coffee and cocktails always tasty and available. For the price, I would like to see terrific eggs and leaner prime rib.

data.title: lunch buffet... such variety, best choice for the money!
data.text: The lunch buffet is truly the best deal whether your traveling for business or just meeting up with friends from soup salad to 3 entree choices and desserts too  You can't not try it ...  even the kids will love the make your own ice cream bar

data.title: Breakfast buffet
data.text:
The Radisson's breakfast buffet WAY exceeded my expectations. It is a bit pricey, $25 per person, I was satisfied by the huge selection of both breakfast and lunch options! 
They have someone cooking made to order omelets, crepes and Belgian w

data.title: good selection of food
data.text: Good selection of food, but the wait staff was a bit slow.  We had to wait awhile for our bill, and that means the wait staff get less of a tip.  It was not busy.

data.title: Quick and Polite Service
data.text: Excellent Food and Service, no complaints here.  I received my meal within 20 minutes of ordering.

data.title: Good breakfast buffet
data.text: Lots of choice, good quality, real eggs. Very attentive staff.
